creator: zifi
title: Quick Start Batch File
description: This project provides a batch file that simplifies launching frequently visited websites by allowing the user to select from a menu after entering a passcode.
steps: Open a text editor and create a new file.

Copy and paste the following code into the file: @echo off color 0f :login cls echo \/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/ echo This is a quick website starter application. echo /\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/ set /p user=enter passcode: if "%user%"=="" goto welcome :welcome cls echo WELCOME USER PLEASE CHOOSE ONE WEBSITE, echo --------------------------- echo --------------------------- echo 1 facebook echo 2 youtube echo 3 ourworld echo 4 downworld echo 5 happy wheels echo 6 gmail set /p user=( You can add new links and app ideas!): if "%user%"=="1" starthttps://www.facebook.com/ if "%user%"=="2" starthttps://www.facebook.com/ if "%user%"=="3" starthttps://www.facebook.com/ if "%user%"=="4" starthttps://www.facebook.com/ if "%user%"=="5" starthttps://www.facebook.com/ if "%user%"=="6" starthttps://www.facebook.com/ goto begin thank you...!!
Save the file with a `.bat` extension (e.g., `website_launcher.bat`).
Run the batch file by double-clicking it.  Follow the prompts to enter the passcode (if any) and select a website from the menu.
To add or modify website links, edit the batch file in a text editor.
